fields.description: Path with a JWT that will stream your file.

fields.description: Filename

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: Absolute path to the filesystem

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Invite
types.description: Invite that can be used to allow other users access to your server.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Library type (0 - movies, 1 - series)

fields.name: name
fields.description: Human readable name of the Library (unused)

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: Path that this library manages

fields.name: isRefreshing
fields.description: Whether olaris-server is currently scanning the library

fields.name: backend
fields.description: Backend for the library (0 - Local filesystem, 1 - Rclone)

fields.name: rcloneName
fields.description: If Backend is Rclone it will return the name of the remote

fields.name: healthy
fields.description: This attribute will be false whenever a Rclone remote can't be reached

types.name: MetadataEvent
types.description:
NOTE(Leon Handreke): I'm a bit unsure about this API design. Maybe the DeletedEvents should
feature a Movie/Episode/... object as well instead of just a UUID? But it would be an
invalid, deleted object at the moment we give it out.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Official title according to the MovieDB

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title based on parsed filename

fields.name: year
fields.description: Release year

fields.name: overview
fields.description: Short description of the movie

fields.name: imdbID
fields.description: IMDB ID

fields.name: tmdbID
fields.description: TMDB ID

fields.name: backdropPath
fields.description: ID to retrieve backdrop

fields.name: posterPath
fields.description: ID to retrieve poster

fields.name: posterURL
fields.description: URL of the poster image

fields.name: fileName
fields.description: Filename

fields.name: filePath
fields.description: Absolute path to the filesystem

fields.name: streams
fields.description: Stream information (subtitles / audio and video streams)

fields.name: totalDuration
fields.description: Total duration of the first video stream in seconds

fields.name: fileSize
fields.description: FileSize in bytes

fields.name: library
fields.description: Get the library for the given file

fields.name: createLibrary
fields.description:
Tell the application to index all the supported files in the given directory.
'kind' can be 0 for movies and 1 for series.
'backend' can be 0 for local and 1 for Rclone.

fields.name: deleteLibrary
fields.description: Delete a library and remove all collected metadata.

fields.name: createUserInvite
fields.description: Create a invite code so a user can register on the server

fields.name: createPlayState
fields.description:
Create a playstate for the given media item can be the UUID of an episode or movie.
Playtime should always be given in seconds.

fields.name: createStreamingTicket
fields.description: Request permission to play a certain file

fields.name: deleteUser
fields.description: Delete a user from the database, please note that the user will be able to keep using the account until the JWT expires.

fields.name: updateStreams
fields.description: Rescans the mediaFile with the given ID (or all, if ID omitted) and updates the stream information in the database.

fields.name: refreshAgentMetadata
fields.description: Refreshes all external agent information (poster/overviews etc.) for the given library or season/series/episode.

fields.name: rescanLibraries
fields.description: Rescan all library paths for new files that are not indexed yet.

fields.name: rescanLibrary
fields.description:
Rescan a library based on the given filters.
1. If supply a "ID" it will refresh the entire library
2. If you supply it an "ID" and a "filepath" it will only scan the specific filepath in the given library
3. If you supply just a "filepath" it will loop over all libraries seeing if any of the given libraries match the given path and then scan only that path.

fields.name: updateMovieFileMetadata
fields.description: Tag an unidentified MovieFile

fields.name: updateEpisodeFileMetadata
fields.description: Retag one or multiple EpisodeFiles

types.name: Query
types.description: The query type, represents all of the entry points into our object graph

fields.name: remotes
fields.description: List of all remotes found in a rclone config file if one exists.

fields.name: folders
fields.description: List folders in the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Path argument as FileLocator path. Examples: 'rclone#gdrive/media/movies', 'local#/home/animazing/movies/'

fields.name: name
fields.description: Localized English series title

fields.name: originalName

fields.name: codecName
fields.description: Name of the codec used for encoding

fields.name: codecMime
fields.description: Mimetype for the codec

fields.name: profile
fields.description: Encoding profile used for codec

fields.name: bitRate
fields.description: Stream bitrate (not file)

fields.name: streamType
fields.description: Type of stream can be either 'video', 'audio' or 'subtitle'

fields.name: language
fields.description: Language used for audio or subtitle types

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title for audio and subtitle streams

fields.name: resolution
fields.description: Title for audio and subtitle streams

fields.name: totalDuration
fields.description: Total duration of the stream in seconds

fields.name: streamID
fields.description: Stream/Track ID as found in the original file

fields.name: streamURL
fields.description: StreamURL

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

inputFields.name: episodeFileUUID
inputFields.description: UUID of the episode file to update

inputFields.name: seriesUUID
inputFields.description:
UUID of the series for which all EpisodeFiles should be updated.
episodeFileUUID and seriesUUID are mutually exclusive.

inputFields.name: tmdbID
inputFields.description:
TMDB ID to update with. The mutation will retrieve the details from TMDB and update the
item appropriately.

inputFields.name: movieFileUUID
inputFields.description: UUID of the movie file to update

inputFields.name: tmdbID
inputFields.description:
TMDB ID to update with. The mutation will retrieve the details from TMDB and update the
item appropriately.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior
in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or
skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information
to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in
a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has
a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all
available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for
query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of
types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that
type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while
Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields
they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types
possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description:
Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion
for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in
[Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
